info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:36PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Branch and northwestern Hillsdale Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bronson to 6 miles south of Quincy. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Reading around 650 PM EDT. Coldwater and Quincy around 655 PM EDT. Union City around 710 PM EDT. Hillsdale, Jonesville and Litchfield around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Montgomery, Girard, Lake Wilson, California, Allen, Kinderhook, Batavia, South Butler, Long Lake and Matteson Lake. This includes Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 2 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
